Description: Slender bottle of Nile silt pottery coated with red slip and burnished. The base is flat, the bulbous body tapers into a long neck, which terminates in an everted rim which was broken off in antiquity and the break ground smooth.
Curator's comments: Similar to Polished Red P62N in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery.
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: William Leonard Stevenson Loat
